judge.rationale: Multiple results from no-reply@accounts.google.com have subjects containing 'Security alert' (e.g., 'Critical security alert...' and 'Security alert for...'). Aggregation also shows 4 from accounts.google.com, meeting the expectation.

Matches include multiple emails titled 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' and 'OpenAI Advisor @ UC Berkeley' from kriswang-gptdao.ai@shared1.ccsend.com (GPTDAO), which align with the requested UC Berkeley event and the expectation.

Matches include Bandsintown notifications referencing LANY, highlighting Soft World Tour Part 1 (2026), a pre-sale code (SOFTWORLDTOUR), and tickets available, plus a welcome email. This directly aligns with the expectation and provides sufficient info to summarize the update.
The matches list Upwork new job alerts with subjects and brief snippets, sufficient to summarize the alert with brief job info; no contradictions present.

The only match is a generic weekly inbox summary for 2025-W43 and does not reference the 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' thread or themes like event details, Berkeley, or speakers. Aggregation is empty, so it does not fulfill the requested weekly rollup for that thread.

The match provides a monthly summary (2025-10) that explicitly highlights job alert themes (AI/GenAI, LLM/agent/RAG, n8n/Make, fullâ€‘stack) and related actions. It aligns with the requested monthly rollup and contains no contradictions. The empty aggregation is non-impactful.

Results include unread messages spanning months (e.g., dates 1750304175 through 1761255498) with no evidence of a received_after filter applied. This suggests older items may be re-fetched, violating the expectation of only items after the last checkpoint and minimal overlap.
